text: Trump Has Reached the Mountaintop  —  Big day for Mike Johnson, whose job and reputation are on the line, to say nothing of his role as dedicated MAGA selfie background guy.  The speaker told reporters this morning he feels confident he can retain his gavel, and do so on the first ballot.

Mike Johnson reelected as House speaker after some GOP holdouts change votes  —  Louisiana Republican Mike Johnson was reelected House speaker Friday on a first vote, overcoming skepticism about his leadership from some in his party.  Johnson clinched the post after two lawmakers who initially voted against him changed their votes.

House GOP tensions erupt ahead of speaker vote … - Johnson is struggling to secure the support he needs to retain his gavel, with Rep. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) digging in in opposition and claiming to reporters several of his colleagues will join him in voting no.

Johnson expected to fail on first vote to reclaim speakership  —  At least one Republican has joined Rep. Thomas Massie in opposing Johnson for speaker on the floor.  —  Mike Johnson is expected to come up short in his bid to remain speaker on the first ballot.
